department.dept_long_name: Department of Molecular and Cellular Biology

course.title: Foundations of Systems Biology and Biological Engineering
course.description: This course builds an understanding of design principles in biology. We will ask why biological circuits are built the way they are and answer using mathematical models. Topics: elementary circuits in biological networks, robustness, pattern-formation in embryos, error-correction, and evolutionary optimization.
course.prerequisites: LPS A or LS 1a, LS 1b and Mathematics 1a/1b, and molecular cell biology at the level of MCB 60 or MCB 52 and MCB 54. Familiarity with mathematics at the level of 19/20 is strongly recommended.
course.notes: Students from physics, engineering and other disciplines are also welcome.
